# Government Tender Announcement

## Tender Details

* **Title**: Environmental Consultant Services - Standing Offer
* **Reference Number**: PW-22-01004902
* **Publication Date**: August 22nd, 2022
* **Tender Closing Date**: September 27th, 2022, 14:00:00
* **Location**: Ontario

## Service Description

Defence Construction Canada is seeking a consulting firm to provide Designated Substances Survey, Hazmat, and Environmental Compliance Consultant services under a Standing Offer (SO) contract. The SO will be valid for a period of three (3) years with a maximum estimated value of $600,000. The services are required to ensure environmental compliance and safety on Department of National Defence locations.

## Evaluation Criteria

The Proponents' information and qualifications will be evaluated based on the established criteria in the RFAP document.

## Submission Requirements

Firms that consider themselves qualified to provide these services are invited to submit their abbreviated proposals through the MERX Electronic Bidding System on or before the closing date.

## Contact Information

Contact Craig Patterson at Defence Construction Canada for more information or details on the tender process:

* **Name**: Craig Patterson
* **Email**: [craig.patterson@dcc-cdc.gc.ca](mailto:craig.patterson@dcc-cdc.gc.ca)
* **Phone**: (613) 794-5311

## Important Notes

* The Security Requirements for this project are identified in the RFAP Documents.
* Call-ups under the SO are expected to be valued between $5,000 and $100,000; the maximum value of a call-up is $350,000.
* Proponents can obtain contract award results from the DCC Website.

This tender is made available through the MERX Electronic Bidding System.  Please reference PW-22-01004902 in your submission. 

This is a sole-source tender and no expression of interest will be accepted. Only consultants with the required qualifications should submit their proposals, otherwise, the proposal will be rejected. Any questions or comments related to this RFP shall be sent to the contact person via email. The proposal envelope must be addressed to DCC General.

**Note**: It seems there were some additional requirements about whitepages and receipt confirmations. They are omitted as they are not considered relevant to the topic at hand.
